ai-mn115:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn115:2.1_0: “Whatever dangers there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-mn115:2.2_0: Whatever perils there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-mn115:2.3_0: Whatever hazards there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-mn115:2.4_0: It’s like a fire that spreads from a hut made of reeds or grass, and burns down even a bungalow, plastered inside and out, draft-free, with latches fastened and windows shuttered.
ai-mn115:2.5_0: In the same way, whatever dangers there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-mn115:2.6_0: Whatever perils there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-mn115:2.7_0: Whatever hazards there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.
ai-mn115:2.8_0: So, the fool is dangerous, but the astute person is safe.
ai-mn115:2.9_0: The fool, who lacks attachment, but the astute
ai-mn115:2.10_0: The fool is hazardous, but the astute person is not.
ai-mn115:2.11_0: There’s no peril regarding the astute, no danger, and threat.
ai-mn115:2.12_0: So you should train like this: ‘We shall be astute, we shall be inquirers.’”
ai-mn115:3.1_0: After this was said, venerable Ānanda addressed the Fortunate One, (saying):
ai-mn115:3.2_0: “Sir, how is a mendicant qualified to be called ‘astute, an inquirer’?”
ai-mn115:3.3_0: “Ānanda, it’s when a mendicant is skilled in the elements, in the sense fields, in dependent origination, and in the possible and the impossible.
ai-mn115:3.4_0: That’s how an astute mendicant is qualified to be called ‘astute’.”
ai-mn115:4.1_0: “But sir, how is a mendicant qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’?”
ai-mn115:4.3_0: the elements of the eye, sights, and eye consciousness;
ai-mn115:4.4_0: the ear, sounds, and ear consciousness;
ai-mn115:4.5_0: the nose, smells, and nose consciousness;
ai-mn115:4.6_0: the tongue, tastes, and tongue consciousness;
ai-mn115:4.7_0: the body element, touch element, and body consciousness element.
ai-mn115:4.8_0: The mind element, the thought element, the mind consciousness element.
ai-mn115:4.9_0: When a mendicant knows and sees these eighteen elements,
ai-mn115:4.10_0: they’re qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’.”
ai-mn115:5.1_0: “But sir, could there be another way in which a mendicant is qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’?”
ai-mn115:5.4_0: earth, water, fire, air, space, and consciousness.
ai-mn115:5.5_0: When a mendicant knows and sees these six elements,
ai-mn115:5.6_0: they’re qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’.”
ai-mn115:6.1_0: “But sir, could there be another way in which a mendicant is qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’?”
ai-mn115:6.4_0: the elements of pleasure, pain, happiness, sadness, equanimity, and ignorance.
ai-mn115:6.5_0: When a mendicant knows and sees these six elements,
ai-mn115:6.6_0: they’re qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’.”
ai-mn115:7.1_0: “But sir, could there be another way in which a mendicant is qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’?”
ai-mn115:7.4_0: the elements of sensuality and renunciation, malice and good will, and cruelty and harmlessness.
ai-mn115:7.5_0: When a mendicant knows and sees these six elements,
ai-mn115:7.6_0: they’re qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’.”
ai-mn115:8.1_0: “But sir, could there be another way in which a mendicant is qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’?”
ai-mn115:8.5_0: When a mendicant knows and sees these three elements,
ai-mn115:8.6_0: they’re qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’.”
ai-mn115:9.1_0: “But sir, could there be another way in which a mendicant is qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’?”
ai-mn115:9.4_0: the conditioned element and the unconditioned element.
ai-mn115:9.5_0: When a mendicant knows and sees these two elements,
ai-mn115:9.6_0: they’re qualified to be called ‘skilled in the elements’.”
ai-mn115:10.1_0: “But sir, how is a mendicant qualified to be called ‘skilled in the sense fields’?”
ai-mn115:10.2_0: “There are these six interior and exterior sense fields:
ai-mn115:10.3_0: the eye and sights, the ear and sounds, the nose and smells, the tongue and tastes, the body and touches, and the mind and thoughts.
ai-mn115:10.4_0: When a mendicant knows and sees these six interior and exterior sense fields,
ai-mn115:10.5_0: they’re qualified to be called ‘skilled in the sense fields’.”
ai-mn115:11.1_0: “But sir, how is a mendicant qualified to be called ‘skilled in dependent origination’?”
ai-mn115:11.3_0: ‘When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.
ai-mn115:11.4_0: When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:
ai-mn115:11.5_0: ignorance is a condition for choices.
ai-mn115:11.6_0: with a (volitional) process as condition: consciousness,
ai-mn115:11.7_0: with consciousness as condition: mind and bodily form,
ai-mn115:11.8_0: because of mind and body: the six sense spheres,
ai-mn115:11.9_0: because of the six sense spheres: contact,
ai-mn115:11.15_0: Rebirth is a condition for old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress to come to be.
ai-mn115:11.16_0: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
ai-mn115:11.17_0: But from the complete fading away and cessation of ignorance, there is the cessation of volitions,
ai-mn115:11.18_0: from the cessation of (volitional) processes, the cessation of consciousness,
ai-mn115:11.19_0: from the cessation of consciousness, the cessation of mind and bodily form,
ai-mn115:11.20_0: from the cessation of mind and bodily form, the cessation of the six sense spheres,
ai-mn115:11.21_0: from the cessation of the six sense spheres, the cessation of contact,
ai-mn115:11.23_0: from the cessation of feeling, the cessation of craving,
ai-mn115:11.24_0: from the cessation of craving, the cessation of attachment,
ai-mn115:11.25_0: with the cessation of attachment, the cessation of continuation,
ai-mn115:11.26_0: from the cessation of continuation, the cessation of birth,
ai-mn115:11.27_0: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
ai-mn115:11.28_0: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.’
ai-mn115:11.29_0: That’s how a mendicant is qualified to be called ‘skilled in dependent origination’.”
ai-mn115:12.1_0: “But sir, how is a mendicant qualified to be called ‘skilled in the possible and impossible’?”
ai-mn115:12.2_0: “It’s when a mendicant understands: ‘It’s impossible for a person accomplished in view to take any condition as permanent. That is not possible.
ai-mn115:12.3_0: But it’s possible for an ordinary person to take some condition as permanent. That is possible.’
ai-mn115:12.4_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a person accomplished in view to take any condition as pleasant.
ai-mn115:12.5_0: But it’s possible for an ordinary person to take some condition as pleasant.’
ai-mn115:12.6_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a person accomplished in view to take anything as self.
ai-mn115:12.7_0: But it’s possible for an ordinary person to take something as self.’
ai-mn115:13.1_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a person accomplished in view to murder their mother.
ai-mn115:13.2_0: But it’s possible for an ordinary person to murder their mother.’
ai-mn115:13.3_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a person accomplished in view to murder their father ... or murder a perfected one.
ai-mn115:13.4_0: But it’s possible for an ordinary person to murder their father ... or a perfected one.’
ai-mn115:13.5_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a person accomplished in view to injure a Realized One with malicious intent.
ai-mn115:13.6_0: But it’s possible for an ordinary person to injure a Realized One with malicious intent.’
ai-mn115:13.7_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a person accomplished in view to cause a schism in the Saṅgha.
ai-mn115:13.8_0: But it’s possible for an ordinary person to cause a schism in the Saṅgha.’
ai-mn115:13.9_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a person accomplished in view to acknowledge another teacher.
ai-mn115:13.10_0: But it’s possible for an ordinary person to acknowledge another teacher.’
ai-mn115:14.1_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for two perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas to arise in the same solar system at the same time.
ai-mn115:14.2_0: But it is possible for just one perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, to arise in one solar system.’
ai-mn115:14.3_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for two wheel-turning monarchs to arise in the same solar system at the same time.
ai-mn115:14.4_0: But it is possible for just one wheel-turning monarch to arise in one solar system.’
ai-mn115:15.1_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a woman to be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
ai-mn115:15.2_0: But it is possible for a man to be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.’
ai-mn115:15.3_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a woman to be a wheel-turning monarch.
ai-mn115:15.4_0: But it is possible for a man to be a wheel-turning monarch.’
ai-mn115:15.5_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a woman to perform the role of identity,
ai-mn115:15.6_0: But it is possible for a man to perform identity.
ai-mn115:15.6_2: They understand: ‘It’s possible for an ordinary person to rest.’
ai-mn115:16.1_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from bad conduct of body, speech, and mind.
ai-mn115:16.2_0: But it is possible for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from bad conduct of body, speech, and mind.’
ai-mn115:16.3_0: It’s impossible, it cannot happen that someone with bad verbal conduct ...
ai-mn115:16.4_0: Anyone who understands a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from bad verbal.
ai-mn115:16.5_0: But it is possible that someone who has bad verbal conduct ...
ai-mn115:16.6_0: When they understand what is unlikable, undesirable, and disagreeable results could be reborn in an undesirable result.
ai-mn115:17.1_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from good conduct of body, speech, and mind.
ai-mn115:17.2_0: But it is possible for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from good conduct of body, speech, and mind.’
ai-mn115:17.3_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for one of good verbal conduct to enjoy good verbal conduct ...
ai-mn115:17.4_0: When they do know of an unlikable, undesirable, and disagreeable results, it’s impossible for them to know.’
ai-mn115:17.5_0: But it is possible that someone of good verbal conduct ...
ai-mn115:18.1_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible that someone who has engaged in bad conduct of body, speech, and mind, could for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-mn115:18.2_0: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in bad bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.’
ai-mn115:19.1_0: They’ve impossible that they should know bad verbal conduct ...
ai-mn115:19.2_0: When their body breaks up, after death, it’s impossible that they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-mn115:19.3_0: But it is possible that someone who has bad verbal conduct ...
ai-mn115:19.4_0: If they were to be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-mn115:19.5_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible that someone who has engaged in good conduct of body, speech, and mind could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, the underworld, a lower realm, hell.
ai-mn115:19.6_0: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in good bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’
ai-mn115:19.7_0: They understand: ‘It’s impossible for someone who has engaged in good verbal conduct ...
ai-mn115:19.8_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-mn115:19.9_0: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in good verbal ...
ai-mn115:19.10_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’
ai-mn115:19.11_0: That’s how a mendicant is qualified to be called ‘skilled in the possible and impossible’.”
ai-mn115:20.1_0: After this was said, venerable Ānanda addressed the Fortunate One, (saying):
ai-mn115:20.3_0: Sir, what is the name of this exposition of the teaching?”
ai-mn115:20.4_0: “In that case, Ānanda, you may remember this exposition of the teaching as ‘The Many Elements’, or else ‘The Four Cycles’, or else ‘The Mirror of the Teaching’, or else ‘The Drum of the Deathless’, or else ‘The Supreme Victory in Battle’.”
ai-mn115:20.5_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn115:20.6_0: Satisfied, Venerable Ānanda was happy with what the Buddha said.
